hero.title: Council
hero.description: Digital solution for Class Councils developed during the CentroWeg apprenticeship (WEG + SENAI)

challenge.title: The Challenge
challenge.description: The process of Class Councils and feedback distribution was carried out 100% in person, causing delays of up to two months in sharing results with students. It was necessary to digitize and optimize the entire workflow.

solution.title: The Solution
solution.description: We developed a complete web platform that digitizes the entire process, from organizing the councils to distributing feedback, with real-time communication and dashboards for monitoring.

microservice.title: Microservices
microservice.description: The architecture was designed with 6 independent microservices, ensuring scalability, maintainability, and responsibility isolation. Each service has its own database and can be developed and deployed independently.

kafka.title: Apache Kafka
kafka.description: We use Kafka as an event bus to ensure asynchronous communication, decoupling between services, scalability in message exchange, and system resilience. Essential for real-time notifications and internal chat.

decoupling.title: Decoupling
decoupling.description: Independent services communicating via events, allowing isolated evolution of each component.

escalability.title: Scalability
escalability.description: Each microservice can be scaled independently according to specific demand.

resiliency.title: Resilience
resiliency.description: Failures in one service do not compromise the operation of the other system components.

hero.title: Machine
hero.description: Digital solution for industrial monitoring with microservices architecture

challenge.title: The Challenge
challenge.description: During the initial testing phase of the machine monitoring system, we faced critical performance issues in high-volume data scenarios. It was necessary to redesign the entire architecture to ensure scalability, reliability, and real-time responsiveness.

solution.title: The Solution
solution.description: We restructured the system using an architecture based on microservices, asynchronous messaging, and distributed processing. The new platform performs real-time monitoring with efficient service communication, interactive dashboards, and automatic fault alerts.

microservice.title: Microservices
microservice.description: The architecture was designed with 4 independent microservices, ensuring scalability, maintainability, and clear separation of responsibilities. Each service has its own database and can be developed and deployed independently.

kafka.title: Apache Kafka
kafka.description: Kafka was used as the event bus to enable asynchronous communication, service decoupling, scalable message exchange, machine data handling, and system resilience. It is essential for real-time notifications and fault alerts.

decoupling.title: Decoupling
decoupling.description: Independent services that communicate via events, allowing each component to evolve in isolation.

scalability.title: Scalability
scalability.description: Each microservice can be scaled independently according to specific demand.

resiliency.title: Resilience
resiliency.description: Failures in a single service do not affect the functionality of the other system components.

student.title: Operators
student.description: Monitor machine data through a dashboard that displays operational conditions.

leader.title: Managers
leader.description: Receive immediate notifications about critical events (failures, performance anomalies) to take timely action.
features: User management with visibility over machine performance
Instant notification of failures and performance anomalies

teacher.title: Analysts
teacher.description: Analyze the data sent by factory machines to the monitoring system, which centralizes information on a server.

pedagogic.title: Administrators
pedagogic.description: Full management of users, machine registration, and alert distribution.
